transcript.title: FATHER WALTER LINI
transcript.content:
I have today sent the following message of condolence to the

Honourable Donald Kalpokas, Prime Minister of Vanuatu, on the death

of Father Walter Lini. Australia will be represented at his funeral

tomorrow morning by the Speaker, the Hon. Neil Andrew, MP:

The Hon. Donald Kalpokas Masike-vanua

Prime Minister

REPUBLIC OF VANUATU

My dear Prime Minister

On behalf of the Australian Government and people, I wish to express

my deepest sympathy to Mrs Mary Lini and her family, and to the Government

and people of Vanuatu, on the death of Father Walter Lini in Port

Vila early this morning.

Father Lini led a distinguished career in the service of his people,

of his country and of the South Pacific region. He steered Vanuatu

to its independence in 1980 and served as the Republic's first

prime minister until 1991. He was known affectionately as the "Father

of Independence" throughout Vanuatu. Until his death he continued

as an active member of the Vanuatu Parliament and in the service of

his home community on Pentecost island.

Committed to his country, he was also a major figure in the South

Pacific region and made an important contribution to the region's

development.

Successive Australian Governments enjoyed a close and productive relationship

with Father Walter Lini and part of his legacy is a strong and healthy

partnership with Australia.

Yours sincerely

(John Howard)

21 February 1999
